intro: Pleopeltis loxogrammoides, commonly known as the broad-leafed rock fern, is a species of fern native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its leathery, elongated fronds. The plant typically grows on rock surfaces or in shaded, moist environments, showcasing its adaptability to rocky substrates. Its fronds are usually divided into lance-shaped segments, with a distinctive, rugged texture. The spores are produced in clusters on the underside of the fronds, typical of its reproductive strategy in the fern family.
